definition.name: urlchecker-action
definition.description: Automatically check for broken links in a project files. This includes python, markdwon, restructured text files and more.
definition.author: Ayoub Malek, Vanessa Sochat

inputs.name: git_path
inputs.description: A project to clone. If not provided, assumes already cloned in the present working directory.

inputs.name: subfolder
inputs.description: A subfolder to parse instead of the root directory.

inputs.name: force_pass
inputs.description: Force pass of checking, regardless of the result.

inputs.name: branch
inputs.description: If a project (git_path) is defined, use this branch. Defaults to master

inputs.name: cleanup
inputs.description: Cleanup (delete) repository to check after doing so (appropriate for when clone is done)

inputs.name: include_files
inputs.description: A comma seperated list of paths or patterns to include.

inputs.name: file_types
inputs.description: A comma-separated list of file types to cover in the URL checks

inputs.name: print_all
inputs.description: Choose whether to include file with no URLs in the prints.

inputs.name: verbose
inputs.description: Choose whether to print a more verbose end summary with files and broken URLs.

inputs.name: retry_count
inputs.description: If a request fails, retry this number of times. Defaults to 1

inputs.name: save
inputs.description: A csv file path to save the results to.

inputs.name: timeout
inputs.description: The timeout (seconds) to provide to requests to wait for a response.

inputs.name: exclude_urls
inputs.description: A comma seperated links to exclude during URL checks.

inputs.name: exclude_patterns
inputs.description: A comma seperated patterns to exclude during URL checks.

inputs.name: exclude_files
inputs.description: A comma seperated list of paths or patterns to exclude during URL checks.

inputs.name: workers
inputs.description: Number of workers to run in parallel (defaults to 9)

evidence.reasoning: The action checks for broken links in project files, which directly relates to maintaining code quality and ensuring that documentation and resources are accessible. It also serves a testing function by validating the integrity of links.
